item.title: Pot holes are in the road just past the entrance to a track - field entrance / layby on the right hand side.going off on the, 19th May
item.description:
Pot holes are in the road just past the entrance to a track - field entrance / layby on the right hand side. The road slopes upwards and the holes are where it narrows to a single car width so it is difficult to miss them. Please can they be filled in. There are other potholes along the Cleeve Common Road towards the common - please can the road be checked as some are deep and the sides of the road especially where there are passing places is eroded.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 19th May
item.description:
Location is Cleeve Common Road ging towards the common and about 100 yards from the turn. There is a field gate on the left hand side to a track and the pot holes are just past it. They are deep and sharp edged. Please can they be filled in.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenhampton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Top End of Pothole Alley - several deep potholes, 19th May
item.description:
The location is the Cotwold Way Road just past the Way Foorpath and to the top end of this stretch of road. They are deeper than indicated and in the vehicl track so vehicles have to move over to the wrong side of the road to avaid them. Please can they be filled in.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes at brow of hill on Aggs Hill Road, 19th May
item.description:
Potholes are on the brow of the hill just past Woodbine Cottage about 10 yards. They are in the track of vehicles especially on the left hand side going up the hill and are difficult to see while driving but are deep enough to cause damage if hit at speed. Please can they be filled in.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aggs Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime tree encroaching on pavement and covered in Ivy, 19th May
item.description:
This is a lovely lime tree on the boundary of number 2 The Park. It does not belong to the owner of the house and is covered in Ivy that is encroaching on the path. It probably needs some TLC and a good trim.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Park, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown verge blocking visibility, 19th May
item.description:
As traffic enters the roundabout from the A40 onto the southbound M5, there's almost zero visibility to traffic established on the roundabout. This is unnecessarily dangerous and should be addressed before someone gets hurt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Golden Valley Junction, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: The path to Gotherington is covered in pig manure., 18th May
item.description:
The right of way footpath through the field to Gotherington is covered in pig manure put there by the farmer. It is in the field with the pylons. It is a tripping hazard and one is unable to walk on it because of the large lumps. The manure has not been spread over the rest of the field. Every year the farmer ploughs through the right of way patch, this year it is worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coffin Path, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very uneven pavement making it difficult for wheelchair user to navigate the pavement safely and in comfort, 18th May
item.description:
The footpath infront of Cheltenham ladies college and health and fitness centre leading to the entrance to the Honeybourne line on Malvern Road is so damaged that my mother nearly fell out of her wheelchair while I tried to wheel her safely for a walk on the Honeybourne line. It is getting worse every time we go.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malvern Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
